name: Veil‚Ñ¢ Hydrating Skin Tint Foundation
about: What it is:¬†A lightweight skin tint that boosts moisture levels by up to 52% for a dewy glow, and provides a sheer veil of coverage for comfortable, all-day wear...Coverage:¬†Light.Finish:¬†Radiant.Formulation:¬†Liquid.Highlighted Ingredients:¬†- Meadowfoam Seed Oil: Replenishes with nourishing fatty acids to strengthen skin‚Äôs moisture barrier..- Hyaluronic Acid: Attracts water to plump skin with hydration..- Plant-Based Squalane: Protects against moisture loss to help retain skin‚Äôs natural radiance...Ingredient Callouts: Free of parabens, phthalates, mineral oil, and triclosan. It is also vegan and cruelty-free...What Else You Need to Know: This formula melts quickly into skin, providing comfortable, all-day wear and a sheer veil of coverage to diffuse imperfections and visibly even skin tone, all while plumping and smoothing the complexion...Clinical Results: Based on a US consumer study of 33 participants after 8 hours:.- 96% said skin feels nourished all day.- 96% said skin feels hydrated all day.- 90% said skin looks healthy all day..This product is an Allure Best of Beauty award winner.
ingredients: Water/Aqua, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Glycerin, Limnanthes Alba (Meadowfoam) Seed Oil, Propanediol, Squalane, C9-12 Alkane, Erythritol, Dicaprylyl Ether, Polyglyceryl-6 Polyricinoleate, Octyldodecanol, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Distarch Phosphate, Phenoxyethanol, Polyglyceryl-2 Isostearate, Magnesium Sulfate, Zinc Stearate, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Dehydroacetate, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter Extract, Hydrogenated Lecithin, Coco-Caprylate/Caprate, Benzoic Acid, Propylene Carbonate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Dehydroacetic Acid, Lecithin, Ethylhexylglycerin, Tocopherol, Ascorbyl Palmitate, Nephelium Lappaceum Peel Extract, Citric Acid, Stearic Acid, Titanium Dioxide (Ci 77891), Iron Oxides (Ci 77491, Ci 77492, Ci 77499). ..Ingredient lists and claims may change or vary from time to time as part of Hourglass‚Äôs commitment to innovation and maintaining global compliance. Please refer to the ingredient list on the product packaging you receive to ensure the ingredients are suitable for your personal use.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Apply on the center of the face, chin, and forehead..-Blend with fingertips, Ambient Soft Glow Foundation Brush (sold separately), or sponge.

reviews.review_title: Lightly airbrushed look with minimal effort
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I never write reviews but THIS IS THE ONE.  I've been looking for the perfect your skin but better product since I started wearing makeup years and years ago. I've always preferred tinted moisturizers with light to medium coverage since I hate *feeling* makeup on my face. For a long time, I alternated between Bare Minerals Complexion Rescue (light coverage, kind of goopy feeling) and Glossier Skin Tint (basically no coverage, but easy to wear). They made me feel put together, but were not perfect.  I'm so glad I took a chance on this tint foundation. It lives up to the name! Light enough that it feels like a tint, but gives me medium coverage like a foundation. Somehow, it gives me that airbrushed look that normally feels impossible to get from a tube. And I just rub it in with my fingers‚Äìyou can use a brush or a sponge, but I love being able to apply makeup like a grade schooler.  I have dry skin, but it's just so easy to apply and get a beautiful finish from this product without having to layer on a ton of skincare. 1000/10, highly recommend.

I had to use 4 oil absorbing sheets to get the bulk of the oil off my face. This has never happened to me before, and when I left the house I looked normal. I have tried different things underneath (no primer because I don't want another product, I want minimal hence tinted moisturizer) and extra moisturizers at night to compensate with zero improvement. Unfortunately I think this is a miss for me; if you're okay being a little more high maintenance and keeping the oil at bay all day long it might work for you.

I didn't find it to be hydrating; while it wasn't necessarily drying either, my skin doesn't feel benefited in any way. It just feels like a really thin foundation, I'm not sure why it is marketed as a skin tint. If you're a fan of Fenty or decently pale but not super pale like myself, this might be a good product for you, but I personally will be returning mine. A reminder to everyone to swatch their products before purchasing and to not just trust the photos!

The closest i had found (before this) was l‚Äôor√©al true match hyaluronic tinted serum, but the shade range is less than ideal so i needed something better. I have a neutral leaning warm light skintone, ashy bronde hair, greyish blueish greenish eyes for shade reference. I first tried this in the summer with a tan and the shade 8 is perfect. Going into fall/winter I need to pick up a new shade (i‚Äôm thinking 6) to match my skin because 8 is too dark for pale me.

reviews.review_title: 4.5 Stars! It's my fav everyday base!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Tan skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: Texture - It transitions from a wet-cream, to a balm that sets into a beautiful finish. With that being said I do recommend trying it with your hands(warmth) and finishing with a dense brush or dry sponge if you like, etc.   Pros:  - Multipurpose: I love wearing it alone for running errands, at the office, or when I want a nice satiny-sheen to my skin.  -  A LITTLE GOES A LONG WAY especially once it's warmed up. I think people use too much of it.  - With proper prep, this is one of the ONLY liquid base products that I can wear WITHOUT setting.  - Pairs very well with Hourglass' concealer, which also has a self-setting effect on my skin.  - Its blurring on my skin and has medium coverage that I don't find to be too buildable but I suppose it's possible. I prefer a light to medium coverage anyways.  - Minimal creasing, if any.  Cons/Learning Curves: - After learning how to use it best on my combo skin, I found that even though I'm oily, I needed to properly hydrate and moisturize with water based products to make it last longer and not emphasize texture.  - It's also not the best shade match, but hourglass doesn't have a decent track record when it comes to that. When set or used with powders, it looks very cakey and creases horribly and I'm not sure why. reviews.review_text: I purchased this product after seeing stellar reviews online and on social media.  I wanted a true skin tint that still felt like my skin/showed my 'imperfections'.  I have not tried other skin tints, so I do not really have anything to compare it to.  It gives a nice glow and kept my layering makeup smooth, vibrant and non-faded.  I think this is a beautiful product for an everyday wear/work/office.  I work long hours (12hr+) in a hospital where I want to remain 'put together' for patients (or when I have important meetings) but still feel like I am not wearing anything.  I think this product is fabulous.  For reference, I have combination/acne prone skin with a developing Oily T-Zone throughout the day.  If you're on the fence d/t the price, just close your eyes when you add it to your shopping cart.

I have combination skin, and it hugged the dry patches while also not lasting through the day (for what I could tell anyway), even with Veil primer, powder, and setting spray. This was a disappointing Hourglass product for me.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I used this product for a bit of time now and I think it's safe to say that it's an okay product. I love bb creams, cc creams, tinted moisturizers. Basically anything lightweight. I definitely loved the shade match for this product and it was a true neutral undertone. I have normal to combo skin and I will say that although this sat nicely on my skin for a normal 8 hour work day, I had to set it really well with a setting spray and powder. It is too dewy for my liking and the consistency is a bit too wet, so if you put too much it starts to look cakey. It takes a while to also sink into the skin but I definitely think that's what keeps your skin moisturized throughout the day. Again, if you're combo this might not work for you but if you have dry skin it could work a lot better.
